title: A little bit 'ghetto fabulous' in style, but friendly nonetheless.
text:
To be honest, if this hotel was elsewhere, I'd objectively give it four rather than five stars. However, it's in Paris... where hotel rooms are often ridiculously poky, and staff can be wearyingly snotty, and since our room at the 'M' was spacious enough to swing a (fairly tolerant) cat in, and had very cheerful staff, I'm inclined to nudge it up into 'five' territory.
Anyway... we chose it because it was close to the Gare de Montparnasse (and it *is* close - although easier to find, if approaching my Metro, if you go to the Gaite metro station instead) and was decently priced, and found it a welcome retreat in a *slightly* frisky part of town (not actually seedy... but gently spicy, if you're prepared to entertain the distinction). Initially, the missus found it a bit much... there was a faintly pimp-y bloke and his, ahem, 'lady friends' in residence... and there were more than a functional number of mirrors in the bedroom and (weirdly...) a large window from the bedroom through into the bathroom (with some extremely decent blinds, thank god...). However... gallic oddness aside, it was really nice... there's a theatre right next door where were saw an excellent conjuror, there are plenty of cheap restaurants and bars nearby, the staff were uniformly pleasant and welcoming... so no grumbles at all, really.
And we *were* able to swing at cat (had we wished to, and been able to obtain one, which we didn't... and couldn't... which is probably for the best). Top marks, then.
